definition: gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
to breathe heavily like an ox (idiom)/to huff and puff

sentences.english: He burst into the room red-faced and out of breath .
sentences.chinese: 他冲进房间，脸色通红，气喘吁吁。

sentences.english: And I’ve stifled in the muggy air of Hefei in Anhui.
sentences.chinese: 亦曾在安徽合肥的闷热天气中气喘如牛。

sentences.english: Until the lane Mo jeans aloud of ask for forgiveness, he just release her.
sentences.chinese: 直到弄墨气喘吁吁的讨饶，他才放开她。

sentences.english: He laid himself down under the thwarts and waited, panting.
sentences.chinese: 躺在坐板下面，气喘吁吁地等着开船。

sentences.english: Dongsheng buries his head in her bosom, and opens his mouth breathlessly.
sentences.chinese: 冬生的头往又福嫂怀中拱，嘴巴张开，气喘吁吁。

sentences.english: We heard her gasping out her children's names.
sentences.chinese: 我们听到她气喘吁吁地说出她孩子们的名字。
为什么你一点儿也不气喘？

sentences.english: The pain made it hard to breathe, and he wheezed , steps flagging.
sentences.chinese: 痛苦使呼吸是困难，而且他气喘，下垂的步骤。

sentences.english: He panted excitedly giving us the news as he had just heard it.
sentences.chinese: 他气喘吁吁，兴奋地将他刚刚听到的消息转告给我们。

sentences.english: When Rodger finally felt his feet touch bottom, he was gasping.
sentences.chinese: 当罗杰的脚终于触碰到水底时，他已气喘嘘嘘了。

sentences.english: By tomorrow, when the sun came up, his fever would subside, and his laboured breathing would relax.
sentences.chinese: 到了明天，太阳一出，热也会退，气喘也会平的。

sentences.english: I've always been able to hold my breath for a long time without having to do the hyperventilating.
sentences.chinese: 我总能闭气很长一段时间而不会气喘吁吁。

sentences.english: Panting, Harry fell forwards over the hydrangea bush, straightened up and stared around.
sentences.chinese: 哈利气喘着向前翻过八仙花灌木，站直并往周围看着。
这个人汗流浃背，气喘吁吁地停了下来并点了点头。

sentences.english: The old man panted forth the hope on his deathbed will.
sentences.chinese: 老人临终时气喘吁吁地说出了他的临终遗嘱。

sentences.english: The old man coughed badly and wheezed out a few words.
sentences.chinese: 那个老人咳嗽得厉害，气喘吁吁地说了几句话。

definition: out of breath (idiom)/to gasp for air
pinyin: shang4 qi4 bu4 jie1 xia4 qi4

definition: lit. dry mouth and tongue (idiom); to talk too much
bacterial tracheitis (inflammation of the windpipe, often caused by Staphylococcus aureus)/henpecked (a pun on 妻子管得严 used in comic theater)
